title.narrative: Emergency Response to Sa’ada governorate humanitarian Crises in Health & Nutrition

description.narrative: -UNICEF will support the training of two doctors and three nurses from Al Salam hospital on the in-patient management of severely and moderately complicated malnutrition. This training will be conducted in the yemeni-sweedish hospital in Taiz. The team of the OTP will be integrated to the training already supported by UNICEF and planned to take place in Saada city before Ramadhan (end August). -Beside the presence of UNICEF consultant in Saada, the Health, Nutrition and water and sanitation staff at UNICEF Sana’a office will organise at least two supervisory visits (one health, one nutrition and one WES staff) to monitor appropriate implementation of UNICEF supported activities. The travel to Saada. The transportation from Sana’a to Saada is only possible by charter. UNICEF is working with WFP and UNHCR to secure safe charter transportation.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Emergency Response to Sa’ada governorate humanitarian Crises in Health & Nutrition

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
